history.proof: destruct (bsm_sss_total ii s) as [t H]. exists t. apply H.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
ii: bsm_instr n
s: bsm_state n

Goal:
exists t : bsm_state n, ii // s -1> t

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive bsm_instr (n : nat) : Set := bsm_pop : pos n -> nat -> nat -> bsm_instr n | bsm_push : pos n -> bool -> bsm_instr n Arguments bsm_instr _%nat_scope Arguments bsm_pop [n]%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments bsm_push [n]%nat_scope _ _%bool_scope
bsm_state = fun n : nat => (nat * vec (list bool) n)%type : nat -> Set Arguments bsm_state _%nat_scope
bsm_sss_total : forall (ii : bsm_instr n) (s : bsm_state n), {t : bsm_state n | ii // s -1> t}
bsm_sss_fun : forall (i : bsm_instr n) (s t1 t2 : bsm_state n), i // s -1> t1 -> i // s -1> t2 -> t1 = t2
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [n : nat ii : bsm_instr n s : bsm_state n |- nat]
bsm_instr_sind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> SProp), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
bsm_instr_rect : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> Type), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
bsm_instr_rec : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> Set), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
bsm_instr_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> Prop), (forall (t : pos n) (n0 n1 : nat), P (POP t n0 n1)) -> (forall (t : pos n) (b : bool), P (PUSH t b)) -> forall b : bsm_instr n, P b
bsm_sss_ind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n -> Prop), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = One :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x])) ->...-> P b b0 b1
bsm_sss_sind : forall (n : nat) (P : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n -> SProp), (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n), v#>x = nil -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (q, v)) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = Zero :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (p, v[ll/x])) -> (forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (p q : nat) (v : vec (list bool) n) (ll : list bool), v#>x = One :: ll -> P (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x])) ->...-> P b b0 b1
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, pos (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, pos n -> pos (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
Inductive t (A : Type) : Type := Empty : VarMap.t A | Elt : A -> VarMap.t A | Branch : VarMap.t A -> A -> VarMap.t A -> VarMap.t A Arguments VarMap.t _%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Empty {A}%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Elt {A}%type_scope Arguments VarMap.Branch {A}%type_scope
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : vec A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, vec A n -> vec A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Inductive bsm_sss (n : nat) : bsm_instr n -> bsm_state n -> bsm_state n ->...-> bsm_sss (POP x p q) (i, v) (1 + i, v[ll/x]) | in_bsm_sss_push : forall (i : nat) (x : pos n) (b : bool) (v : vec (list bool) n), bsm_sss (PUSH x b) (i, v) (1 + i, v[(b :: v#>x)/x]) Arguments bsm_sss [n]%nat_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_E [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_0 [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope _ [ll]%list_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_pop_1 [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope _ [ll]%list_scope Arguments in_bsm_sss_push [n]%nat_scope _%nat_scope _ _%bool_scope
sss_stall_step_stall : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (st : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_step_stall one_step P st
sss_stall_step_0 : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (ii : instr) (P : nat * list instr) (q : nat) (st st' : nat * data), (fst st, ii :: nil) <sc P -> sss_stall one_step ii st -> sss_steps one_step P q st st' -> q = 0 /\ st = st'
PUSH : forall n : nat, pos n -> bool -> bsm_instr n
POP : forall n : nat, pos n -> nat -> nat -> bsm_instr n
BSM_HALTING = fun P : BSM_PROBLEM => let (n, s) := P in let (i, s0) := s in let (P0, v) := s0 in sss_terminates (bsm_sss (n:=n)) (i, P0) (i, v) : BSM_PROBLEM -> Prop
pos_O_inv = let pos_inv_t := fun n : nat => match n as x return (pos x -> Set) with | 0 => fun _ : pos 0 => False | S n0 => fun i : pos (S n0) => ((i = pos0) + {p : pos n0 | i = pos_nxt p})%type end in let pos_inv := fun (_tmp : nat) (p0 : pos _tmp) => match p0 as t in (pos n) return (pos_inv_t n t) with | @Fin.F1 n => inl eq_refl | @Fin.FS n p => inr (exist (fun p1 : pos n => pos_nxt p = pos_nxt p1) p eq_refl) end in pos_inv 0 : pos 0 -> False
subcode = fun (X : Type) (P : code X) (Q : nat * list X) => let (i, li) := P in let (n, code) := Q in exists l r : list X, code = l ++ li ++ r /\ i = n + length l : forall X : Type, code X -> nat * list X -> Prop Arguments subcode {X}%type_scope _ _ /
sss_steps_inv : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (P : nat * list instr) (k : nat) (st1 st3 : nat * data), sss_steps one_step P k st1 st3 -> (k = 0 /\ st1 = st3) + {k' : nat | exists st2 : nat * data, k = S k' /\ sss_step one_step P st1 st2 /\ sss_steps one_step P k' st2 st3}
Inductive Op2 : Set := OpEq : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpNEq : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpLe : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpGe : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpLt : RingMicromega.Op2 | OpGt : RingMicromega.Op2
measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
rpow_pow_N : forall (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R), power_theory rI rmul req Cp_phi rpow -> forall (r : R) (n : BinNums.N), req (rpow r (Cp_phi n)) (pow_N rI rmul r n)
vec_pos_set : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (g : pos n -> X) (p : pos n), vec_set_pos g#>p = g p
ZifyClasses.mkapp2 : forall (S1 S2 S3 T : Type) (Op : S1 -> S2 -> S3) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (I3 : S3 -> T) (TBOP : T -> T -> T), (forall (n : S1) (m : S2), I3 (Op n m) = TBOP (I1 n) (I2 m)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S2) (t2 : T), I2 s2 = t2 -> I3 (Op s1 s2) = TBOP t1 t2
ZifyClasses.mkapp : forall (S1 S2 T : Type) (OP : S1 -> S2) (I1 : S1 -> T) (I2 : S2 -> T) (TUOP : T -> T), (forall n : S1, I2 (OP n) = TUOP (I1 n)) -> forall (s1 : S1) (t1 : T), I1 s1 = t1 -> I2 (OP s1) = TUOP t1
induction_ltof1 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (P : A -> Type), (forall x : A, (forall y : A, ltof A f y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
morph0 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> req (phi cO) rO
morph1 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R), ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req cO cI cadd cmul csub copp ceqb phi -> req (phi cI) rI
list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}}
Record Formula (T : Type) : Type := Build_Formula { Flhs : EnvRing.PExpr T; Fop : RingMicromega.Op2; Frhs : EnvRing.PExpr T } Arguments RingMicromega.Formula _%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.Build_Formula [T]%type_scope
ZifyClasses.mkrel : forall (S T : Type) (R : S -> S -> Prop) (I : S -> T) (TR : T -> T -> Prop), (forall n m : S, R n m <-> TR (I n) (I m)) -> forall (s1 : S) (t1 : T), I s1 = t1 -> forall (s2 : S) (t2 : T), I s2 = t2 -> R s1 s2 < -> TR t1 t2
Record power_theory (R : Type) (rI : R) (rmul : R -> R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (Cpow : Type) (Cp_phi : BinNums.N -> Cpow) (rpow : R -> Cpow -> R) : Prop := mkpow_th { rpow_pow_N : forall (r : R) (n : BinNums.N), req (rpow r (Cp_phi n)) (pow_N rI rmul r n) } Arguments power_theory [R]%type_scope _ (_ _)%function_scope [Cpow]%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope Arguments mkpow_th [R]%type_scope _ (_ _)%function_scope [Cpow]%type_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
Record rsplit (C : Type) : Type := mk_rsplit { rsplit_left : Ring_polynom.PExpr C; rsplit_common : Ring_polynom.PExpr C; rsplit_right : Ring_polynom.PExpr C } Arguments Field_theory.rsplit _%type_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_rsplit [C]%type_scope
in_sss_step : forall (instr : Set) (data : Type) (one_step : instr -> nat * data -> nat * data -> Prop) (k : nat) (l : list instr) (i : instr) (r : list instr) (st1 st2 : nat * data), fst st1 = k + length l -> one_step i st1 st2 -> sss_step one_step (k, l ++ i :: r) st1 st2
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); ARdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (...
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
Field_theory.AFdiv_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q))
Field_theory.AF_1_neq_0 : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> ~ req rI rO
